neighbors.name: Cherry Tree Timber LLC C/O Property Tax Administration
neighbors.claims: Cherry Tree Timber LLC is a foreign-owned land holding entity (United Kingdom) [VDACS](https://www.vdacs.virginia.gov/pdf/annual-report-on-foreign-owned-land.pdf) managed by the Molpus Woodlands Group, a major timber investment management organization [Molpus](https://www.molpus.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/ValueAdded_LandSale_Img_PEN_CTTVALS0001.pdf). The company's mailing address in Jackson, MS corresponds to the Molpus headquarters, confirming its status as an investment vehicle rather than a local operator [King William County](https://www.kwc.gov/DocumentCenter/View/1106/2021LandUseCounty). While the entity has not publicly commented on the Spotsylvania solar project, it has demonstrated active engagement in land-use zoning in other Virginia counties (e.g., Nottoway County) to secure special exceptions for revenue-generating activities like hunting leases [Nottoway County](https://cms8.revize.com/revize/nottowaycountyva/03192024%20Staff%20Packet.pdf). This behavior indicates a rational economic approach to land asset management rather than ideological opposition to development.
neighbors.influence_justification: Absentee commercial owner managed by a third-party investment firm (Molpus); no evidence of local political leadership or community organizing in Spotsylvania.

approach_recommendations.engage: Contact Molpus Woodlands Group directly, as they manage the asset. Position the solar development as a compatible land use or a divestment opportunity that aligns with their timber investment cycle. They are sophisticated financial actors likely to respond to ROI arguments rather than community sentiment.

neighbors.name: GTP Acquisition Partners II LLC C/O Property Tax Dept
neighbors.claims: GTP Acquisition Partners II, LLC is a subsidiary of American Tower Corporation, a major global telecommunications real estate investment trust [GovTribe](https://govtribe.com/vendors/gtp-acquisition-partners-ii-llc-g-t-p-4kl25). The entity functions as a holding company for tower assets and is listed as a subsidiary in American Tower's SEC filings [SEC](https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1053507/000105350721000026/exhibit21fy2020.htm). Its primary business activity involves leasing antenna space to government agencies and wireless carriers [GovTribe](https://govtribe.com/vendors/gtp-acquisition-partners-ii-llc-g-t-p-4kl25). There is no record of this entity engaging in local land use advocacy in Spotsylvania; its interests are likely strictly limited to the technical non-interference of its tower infrastructure.
neighbors.influence_justification: Corporate subsidiary with no local personnel or community presence; influence is limited to federal/technical telecommunications rights.

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with American Towerâ€™s site management team regarding technical specifications (setbacks, glare analysis) to ensure the solar array does not impact tower operations. Confirming non-interference will likely secure a neutral position.

neighbors.name: George A Sr & Kathryn B Reina Co-Tr George A Reina Sr Living Trust
neighbors.claims: This entity appears to be a private family trust holding residential or agricultural property. Comprehensive searches of Spotsylvania County Board of Supervisors minutes, planning commission records, and local media letters to the editor yielded no public statements, testimony, or positions regarding solar development associated with this trust or the named trustees.
neighbors.influence_justification: Private family trust; no public record of community leadership or political involvement found.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via standard resident outreach protocols (mailers/open house invitations). No specific data suggests high risk or specific leverage points.
